title-part.text: CYLINDERS, PISTONS OR CASINGS, FOR COMBUSTION ENGINES
ARRANGEMENTS OF SEALINGS IN COMBUSTION ENGINES

reference.text: specially adapted for rotary-piston or oscillating-piston internal-combustion engines F02B ; specially adapted for gas-turbine plants F02C ; specially adapted for jet-propulsion plants F02K

note.note-paragraph: Attention is drawn to the notes preceding class F01 .
In considering the relationship between class F16 and subclass F02F , class F16 will take precedence unless the subject-matter is specific to combustion engines.

CPC-specific-text.text: Integrally formed cylinders and cylinder heads

title-part.text: Shape or arrangement of cooling fins

CPC-specific-text.text: with means for directing or distributing cooling medium

title-part.text: running-liner and cooling-part of cylinder being different parts or of different material

CPC-specific-text.text: Siamese-type cylinders, i.e. cylinders cast together

title-part.text: Cylinders with means for directing, guiding or distributing liquid stream

CPC-specific-text.text: for use in engines with two or more pistons reciprocating within same cylinder

title-part.text: characterised by constructional features providing for lubrication
characterised by having ports in cylinder wall for scavenging or charging

CPC-specific-text.text: Arrangement of spark plugs or injectors
Cylinder heads and inlet or exhaust manifolds integrally cast together
the cylinder heads being of side valve type

title-part.text: the cylinder heads being of overhead valve type
with means for directing or distributing cooling medium

CPC-specific-text.text: the cylinder heads being of side valve type

title-part.text: the cylinder heads being of overhead valve type
Cylinder heads with means for directing, guiding, or distributing liquid stream
Shape or arrangement of intake or exhaust channels in cylinder heads

CPC-specific-text.text: specially adapted for four or more valves per cylinder
particularly for three or more inlet valves

reference.text: mechanisms for driving such valves F01L1/265

CPC-specific-text.text: with a partition wall inside the channel
with a separate deviation element inside the channel
of both intake and exhaust channel
the parts being bolted or screwed together
the parts being connected by casting, brazing, welding or clamping
the crown and skirt being interconnected by the gudgeon pin
the inside of the pistons being provided with ribs or fins
the pistons being constructed from specific materials

title-part.text: having means for accomodating or controlling heat expansion

CPC-specific-text.text: the pistons having an oval circumference or non-cylindrical shaped skirts, e.g. oval
having circumferentially slotted piston skirts, e.g. T-slots
the inserts consisting of reinforcements in the skirt interconnecting separate wall parts, e.g. rods or strips
the inserts being located in the crown
the inserts being located around the gudgeon pin bearings
the coverings forming a double skirt

title-part.text: the means being a liquid or solid coolant, e.g. sodium, in a closed chamber in piston
the means being a fluid flowing through or along piston

CPC-specific-text.text: the liquid being directed into blind holes

title-part.text: having means for guiding gases in cylinders, e.g. for guiding scavenging charge in two-stroke engines
having combustion chamber in piston head

reference.text: the surface thereof being covered F02F3/14

CPC-specific-text.text: the head being provided with an insert located in or on the combustion-gas-swept surface

title-part.text: Piston rings, e.g. associated with piston crown

CPC-specific-text.text: Crankcases of engines with cylinders in line
Crankcases of W-, deldic, or quadratic engines, or the like
Cylinders and crankshaft not in one plane (deaxation)
Built from sheet material and welded casings
Casings for two-stroke engines with scavenging conduits
Casings for small engines, especially with crankcase pumps
Shape of casings adapted to facilitate fitting or dismantling of engine parts
Crankshaft bearings fitted in the crankcase
Shape of casings for other machine parts and purposes, e.g. utilisation purposes, safety
Adaptations for fitting the engine, e.g. front-plates or bell-housings
Materials for constructing engines or their parts

title-part.text: Arrangements of sealings in combustion engines
having a ring at the inside of a liner or cylinder for preventing the deposit of carbon oil particles, e.g. oil scrapers
Stress problems, especially related to thermal stress
using an open deck, i.e. the water jacket is open at the block top face
using a closed deck, i.e. the water jacket is not open at the block top face
specially adapted to pent roof shape of the combustion chamber
Arrangement of valve stems in cylinder heads
the valve stems being orientated at an angle with the cylinder axis
and orientated radially from the combustion chamber surface
the valve stems being orientated in parallel with the cylinder axis
Methods for avoiding thermal stress-induced cracks in the zone between valve seat openings
with flame plate, e.g. insert in the cylinder head used as a thermal insulation between cylinder head and combustion chamber
Shape or arrangement of intake or exhaust channels in cylinder heads
Arrangements with one conduit connected with two valves
Arrangements connecting one valve with two conduits

CPC-specific-text.text: the parts being connected by casting, brazing, welding or clamping
Crankshaft bearings fitted in the crankcase

title-part.text: using bearing beams, i.e. bearings interconnected by a beam or multiple beams

CPC-specific-text.text: Shape of casings for other machine parts and purposes, e.g. utilisation purposes, safety
Adaptations for fitting the engine, e.g. front-plates or bell-housings
Materials for constructing engines or their parts

title-part.text: Hypereutectic aluminum, e.g. aluminum alloys with high SI content
using a lost model, e.g. foam casting
using wrought materials, e.g. wrought steels
